alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 10:59AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is starting the snow melt. High temperatures over the next several days will range from the low 50s to the upper 60s in forested areas. This is expected to further ripen the snow pack and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers resulting in rapid rises. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later toward the weekend, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday morning and continue rising to a crest of 15.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. The crest may vary between 14.5 feet to 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
